meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a monograph.
meanings.sent1: The professor assigned a monographic project to each student.
meanings.sent2: The library had a special section dedicated to monographic works.
meanings.sent3: The monographic presentation was so detailed that it put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her monographic analysis of the painting revealed hidden symbols and meanings.
meanings.sent5: The monographic description of the rare bird made it easy to identify in the wild.

meanings.definition: Consisting of a single, detailed study or essay.
meanings.sent1: The monographic report on climate change was eye-opening.
meanings.sent2: She received praise for her monographic research on ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The monographic investigation into cookie recipes was both informative and delicious.
meanings.sent4: His monographic examination of the crime scene uncovered crucial evidence.
meanings.sent5: The monographic study of marine life revealed fascinating new species.
